algorithms.imageProcessing

Class EdgeExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.imageProcessing.AbstractEdgeExtractor
      • algorithms.imageProcessing.EdgeExtractor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEdgeExtractor

    public class EdgeExtractor
extends AbstractEdgeExtractor
    Edge extractor operates on an image that has already been reduced to single pixel width lines and extracts edges from it, attempting to make the longest edges it can.
    Author:
    nichole
    See Also:
    Edge extraction Local Methods: (1) DFS walk through connected pixel to form a sequence of pixels called an edge. (2) merge adjacent edges at the endpoints. (3) merge curves by closest points if the outlying points can be safely trimmed. (4) find edge endpoints which are separated from one another by a gap of one and fill in the gap while merging the edges. (5) remove edges shorter than a minimum length

    • Constructor Detail

      • EdgeExtractor

        public EdgeExtractor(GreyscaleImage input)
        NOTE: input should have a black (empty) background and edges should have values > 125 counts. Edges should also have width of 1 and no larger.
        Parameters:
        input -

      • EdgeExtractor

        public EdgeExtractor(GreyscaleImage input,
                     GreyscaleImage anEdgeGuideImage)
        NOTE: input should have a black (empty) background and edges should have values > 125 counts. Edges should also have width of 1 and no larger. The guide image is used to alter the extracted edges back towards the highest intensity pixels of the guide image. The guide image is expected to be the combined X and Y gradient image from earlier processing stages.
        Parameters:
        input -
        anEdgeGuideImage -

    • Method Detail

      • findEdgesIntermediateSteps

        public java.util.List<PairIntArray> findEdgesIntermediateSteps(java.util.List<PairIntArray> edges)
        this method is invoked by the super class after the DFS connect of points in the image to make edges. It merges the edges that have adjacent endpoints. It then looks for locations within the edges where it can connect to other edges by trimming a small number of pixels between them.
        Specified by:
        findEdgesIntermediateSteps in class AbstractEdgeExtractor
        Returns:

      • mergeAdjacentEndPoints

        protected java.util.List<PairIntArray> mergeAdjacentEndPoints(java.util.List<PairIntArray> edges)
        merge edges adjacent end points of given edges. For best results, make sure the edges were created from an image whose lines were thinned to 1 pixel widths. the runtime complexity is at best O(N).
        Parameters:
        edges -
        Returns:

      • findClosestPair

        protected double findClosestPair(PairIntArray curve0,
                                 PairIntArray curve1,
                                 int[] curve0Idx,
                                 int[] curve1Idx)
        find the closest point between the curve0 and curve1 and return the points in curve0XY and curve1XY along with the method return value which is the separation. runtime complexity: O(N_edge1 x N_edge2)
        Parameters:
        curve0 -
        curve1 -
        curve0Idx - output variable to hold index to the (x, y) of the point in curve0 which is closest to curve0
        curve1Idx - output variable to hold index to the (x, y) of the point in curve0 which is closest to curve1
        Returns:
        the separation between the closest pair of points in curve0 and curve1

      • connectClosestPointsIfCanTrim

        protected java.util.List<PairIntArray> connectClosestPointsIfCanTrim(java.util.List<PairIntArray> edges)
        connect the closest points in edges if trimming the outliers does not remove too many points nor add a discontinuity in either edge. Runtime complexity: O(N_edge x ~N_edge x (N_edge to N_edge^2))
        Parameters:
        edges -
        Returns:

      • findStartingPoint

        protected PairInt findStartingPoint(PairInt startPoint,
                                    java.util.Map<PairInt,java.lang.Integer> endPointMap,
                                    java.util.List<PairIntArray> edges)
        Search endMap "backwards" to find the earliest match to the startPoint. When a junction is found, choose the longest edge. 
                   -- find 
             \
              \
               \           start
                \find     *point
             |---/-------||------|
       discard
        Parameters:
        startPoint -
        endPointMap -
        edges -
        Returns:
